qas.question: Where are many of the Bronx's playwrights from?
How many seats does the Pregones' new theater have?
What does the Pregones specialize in?
When did the Pregones' new theater open?
Where is the Pregones' new theater?

answers.text: on Walton Avenue in the South Bronx

context: The Bronx is home to several Off-Off-Broadway theaters, many staging new works by immigrant playwrights from <a0_0>Latin America and Africa<a0_0/>. The Pregones Theater, which produces <a2_0>Latin American work<a2_0/>, opened a new <a1_0>130<a1_0/>-seat theater in <a3_0>2005<a3_0/> <a4_0>on Walton Avenue in the South Bronx<a4_0/>. Some artists from elsewhere in New York City have begun to converge on the area, and housing prices have nearly quadrupled in the area since 2002. However rising prices directly correlate to a housing shortage across the city and the entire metro area.
